problem.label: 1. Which of the following languages and frameworks do we primarily use?

checkboxgroup.choice: Javascript That’s right! The Open edX codebase uses Javascript.
Angular That is not correct. The Open edX platform does not use Angular. Try again!
React That’s right! The Open edX codebase uses React.
Python That’s right! The Open edX codebase uses Python.
Flask That is not correct. The Open edX platform does not use Flask. Try again!
Django That’s right! The Open edX codebase uses Django.

problem.label: 2. Which of the following database technologies do we use?

checkboxgroup.choice: OracleDB That is not correct. The Open edX platform does not use OracleDB. Try again!
MongoDB That’s right! The Open edX uses MongoDB.
SQLite That is not correct. The Open edX platform does not use SQLite. Try again!
MySQL That’s right! The Open edX uses MySQL.
MariaDB That is not correct. The Open edX platform does not use MariaDB. Try again!
PostgreSQL That is not correct. The Open edX platform does not use PostgreSQL. Try again!

problem.label: 3. True or False? If I’m running 2 different Python projects locally on my computer, using venvs won’t provide any benefit to me.

choicegroup.choice: True That is not correct. Re-read the “Managing Local Development section and try again!
False That’s right! Venvs (or virtual environments) let you develop on different branches or repositories.
